security_audit.summary: This skill is documentation-only (markdown) for QA checks. No executable code is present. Static findings are false positives: backtick references are markdown code fences, not shell execution; cryptographic algorithm flags are content hashes; filesystem access is standard error suppression for file checks. All documented commands are legitimate development tools (gradle, pnpm, vitest).

content.user_title: Automate quality checks before PR creation
content.value_statement: Manual quality checks are time-consuming and error-prone. This skill automatically runs lint, tests, builds, and coverage verification to ensure code meets quality standards before pull request creation.
actual_capabilities: Runs backend lint checks using Checkstyle and SpotBugs
Executes frontend lint checks using Biome and ESLint
Verifies test coverage meets 80 percent minimum threshold
Validates successful builds for frontend and backend
Generates comprehensive QA reports with pass or fail status
limitations: Fixed coverage thresholds cannot be customized

best_practices: Always run QA checks before creating pull requests to catch issues early
Fix all critical lint errors and ensure tests pass before requesting reviews
Maintain coverage above 90 percent for business logic to ensure code reliability
anti_patterns: Skipping coverage checks to hide low test coverage
Ignoring lint warnings which may indicate code quality issues
Running checks only on one part of the stack when changes affect both

faq.question: What coverage thresholds does this skill enforce?
faq.answer: The skill requires 80 percent overall coverage and 90 percent for business logic. Frontend requires 75 percent for logic and 45 percent for UI.

faq.question: Can I run checks on just frontend or backend?
faq.answer: Yes, use target="frontend" or target="backend" to check only one part of your stack. Default checks both.

faq.question: What happens if checks fail?
faq.answer: The skill reports specific failures with error details. Fix the issues and rerun. The PR should not be created until all checks pass.

faq.question: Is my code data safe during checks?
faq.answer: The skill only runs standard lint and test commands. It does not modify code or send data externally. All processing happens locally.

faq.question: How do I interpret the coverage report?
faq.answer: The report shows percentage coverage. Aim for green (90 percent plus) on business logic. Yellow (80-89 percent) is acceptable but should be improved.

faq.question: Can this replace my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: No, this complements CI/CD by catching issues early. Always ensure your pipeline also runs these checks before merging.
